newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks close flat, turnover rises.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks close flat, turnover rises.

text.p: Sri Lankan stocks closed little changed but turnover, supported by active trading in two blue chips, was up sharply, brokers said.
The Colombo Stock Exchange all share index closed at 556.3, against Thursday's close of 556.6. Foreign purchases were 26.9 million rupees, and sales were 19 million, brokers said.

Turnover, supported by a pre-arranged deal of 74,300 development bank DFCC at 265 rupees per share, was 28.7 million rupees. Conglomerate Hayleys was also actively traded with 36,400 shares changing hands at 180 rupees per share, up five rupees from Thursday.
The all share index did not change much despite the buoyant turnover because most shares remained range-bound, a broker for Jardine Fleming HNB said.
"When compared to the past couple of days, it was an active day today," he said. "Normally, we've been looking at turnovers of less than 10 million rupees."
Development bank NDB rose one rupee to 190.
